title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus)
description: Up-to-date COVID-19 (Coronavirus) information for Cedars-Sinai patients and visitors: facts, policies, frequently asked questions, and event cancellations.
cleaned_text: for you, and we are committed to your health and safety. As we continue to monitor COVID-19 cases in our community, Cedars-Sinai has taken steps to keep you safe. How We Are Keeping You Safe Vaccine Information For the latest information from Cedars-Sinai on the COVID-19 vaccine, please [click here](/blog/covid-19-vaccine-patient-update.html). - To schedule a vaccination appointment, visit the California Department of Public Health's [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/)website. - Visit the [LA County Department of Health's eligibility chart (PDF)](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/docs/vaccine/COVIDVaccineSchedule.pdf)to determine if you are eligible for COVID-19 vaccine primary, booster or additional doses. - Even after being vaccinated, you should follow [CDC guidelines](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/prevention.html)—including wearing a mask and practicing physical distancing as appropriate. COVID-19 vaccine information continues to evolve. The following resources are available for the most up-to-date information: Testing Information Testing at Cedars-Sinai is available to adults and children ages 2 years and older [for whom testing is recommended](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/testing.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Ftesting%2Fdiagnostic-testing.html). Minors under 18 years of age must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. If you are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms or have been exposed and need to be tested, consider one of the following options: - Contact Your Primary Care Physician Your primary care physician will discuss your symptoms and possible exposure with you. If appropriate, your physician may place an order for a COVID-19 test at the Cedars-Sinai drive-through testing site. - Visit a Cedars-Sinai Urgent Care Our Cedars-Sinai [urgent care locations](/programs/urgent-care.html)offer COVID-19 testing. Please note that COVID-19 testing is offered as part of a visit with an urgent care provider. Diagnostic COVID-19 testing is also widely available throughout L.A. County, whether or not you have symptoms or have been exposed. Refer to [L.A. County's COVID-19 testing website](https://dhs.lacounty.gov/covid-19/testing/) for locations in your region. Planning Your Visit To Cedars-Sinai - Your procedure: If you have an appointment scheduled for a medical office visit or imaging appointment, please review our [current policies](/public-health-topics/preparing-your-visit/procedures.html). - Your surgery: For scheduled surgeries, please review our [current policies for surgery](/public-health-topics/preparing-your-visit/procedures/surgery-visits.html). - Visitor policy: We continue to evaluate our [visitor policy](/public-health-topics/preparing-your-visit/visitor-policy-updates.html)to allow people to safely visit their loved ones.
